markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub! ‚ù§Ô∏è

To convert string to int16 in golang, just use ParseInt() method with int16() and pass your string, it will convert string into int16.

As we know the ParseInt() method always return int64 so that‚Äôs why we have to use int16() to convert int64 to int16.

Important Points

Difference between int and uint

UInt does not allow for negative numbers.

uint‚Äôs and int‚Äôs max value

uint8  : 0 to 255 
uint16 : 0 to 65535 
uint32 : 0 to 4294967295 
uint64 : 0 to 18446744073709551615 
int8   : -128 to 127 
int16  : -32768 to 32767 
int32  : -2147483648 to 2147483647 
int64  : -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807

Follow the below tutorial if you are struggling with installing GO in windows.

https://aguidehub.com/blog/how-to-install-golang-in-windows

Today, I will show you how do I convert string to int16 in golang, as above mentioned I‚Äôm going to use ParseInt() way.

The strconv package provide ParseInt() method.

Let‚Äôs start our Golang convert string to int16 example

Convert whole string into int16 example

main.go

package main

import (
	"strconv"
	"fmt"
	"reflect"
)

func main() {
	var s string = "10"
  i, err := strconv.ParseInt(s, 10, 64)
  if err != nil {
      panic(err)
  }
  fmt.Println(i, reflect.TypeOf(i))
  
  i16 := int16(i)
  fmt.Println(i16, reflect.TypeOf(i16))
}

In the above example, we have converted string to int16 and printed in golang console. let‚Äôs check the output.

Output

10 int64
10 int16

Try it Yourself

I hope it helps you, All the best üëç.
